meanings.definition: The quality of having or showing good judgment or sense.
meanings.sent1: Her judiciousnesses in handling difficult situations impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: His judiciousnesses in financial matters helped him save money for the future.
meanings.sent3: The judiciousnesses of the cat in choosing the warmest spot in the house made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The judiciousnesses of the old tree in shedding its leaves at the right time amazed the gardener.
meanings.sent5: The judiciousnesses of the detective in solving the case left a lasting impression on the town.

meanings.definition: The act of making wise decisions or choices.
meanings.sent1: The judiciousnesses of the committee led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent2: Her judiciousnesses in selecting the right candidate for the job were commendable.
meanings.sent3: The judiciousnesses of the squirrel in picking the ripest nuts entertained the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His judiciousnesses in navigating through the maze of options were like a guiding light.
meanings.sent5: The judiciousnesses of the captain in steering the ship through the storm saved the crew from disaster.
